org.netbeans.spi.wizard
Interface WizardController

public interface WizardController

Controller which can be used to modify the UI state of a wizard. Passed as an argument to methods of PanelProvider. Use this interface to determine whether the Next/Finish buttons should be enabled, and if some problem explanation text should be displayed.

If you are implementing this interface, you are probably doing something wrong. Use instances of this interface passed to WizardPanelProvider.createPanel.

Author:
Tim Boudreau

Method Summary
 void setBusy(boolean busy)
          Indicate that some sort of background process is happening (presumably a progress bar is being shown to the user) which cannot be interrupted.
 void setCanFinish(boolean value)
          Indicate that the Finish button of the wizard should be enabled (assuming setProblem has not been called with a non-null value).
 void setProblem(java.lang.String value)
          Indicate that there is a problem with what the user has (or has not) input, such that the Next/Finish buttons should be disabled until the user has made some change.
 

Method Detail

setProblem

void setProblem(java.lang.String value)
Indicate that there is a problem with what the user has (or has not) input, such that the Next/Finish buttons should be disabled until the user has made some change.

Pass null to indicate there is no problem; non-null indicates there is a problem - the passed string should be a localized, human-readable description that assists the user in correcting the situation.

setCanFinish

void setCanFinish(boolean value)
Indicate that the Finish button of the wizard should be enabled (assuming setProblem has not been called with a non-null value).

setCanFinish means two different things, depending on the type of wizard. In a wizard created by a WizardBranchController, it only enables the finish button if the sub-wizard in question is the last in the branching structure; if it is not, setting canFinish to true indicates that the next steps in the wizard may now be known, and it should try to find the next sub-wizard to continue.

setBusy

void setBusy(boolean busy)
Indicate that some sort of background process is happening (presumably a progress bar is being shown to the user) which cannot be interrupted. Calling this menu disables all navigation and the ability to close the wizard dialog. Use this option with caution and liberal use of finally to reenable navigation.
